poem.title: Dog /Gyp
poem.author: Peter McCarey
poem.text: Tongue tripping him Barking his brains loose Crotch-otrope Scared silly by the aliens in his nose Stuck between pursuit and usufruct (he won't Give up the ball), anxious as a linesman, yet, Out walking, seized of a stick, happiness is. Ours was never house-trained Nor bit back at kicks or yanks on the leash. Sister got it, mum looked after it, Dad had it put down. No way To treat a guest. No way to be.
